item.title: 1337UP 2024 - Full Writeup
item.author: theSaucese
item.description:
Intro

Amazing CTF, beginner friendly and is barely guessy, I wish I had more time to solve more challenges, it was super fun. This writeup contains all the challenges that I solved, Crypto, Misc, Osint, Rev and Web.

item.title: SpookyCTF 2024 - Full Writeup
item.author: theSaucese
item.description:
Intro

This CTF was fun and I would recommend it for beginners ! On par with DeadFace.

This writeup contains all the challanges that I have solved (14 challenges).

The categories were : Forensics, Osint, Steganography, Misc and Web (Well, technically it’s Reverse).

item.title: Cyber Odyssey 2024 - easy license
item.author: theSaucese
item.description: Description : Crack a license for JVNE and submit it remotely to get your flag.

item.title: Cyber Odyssey 2024 - Trenbolone Acetate
item.author: theSaucese
item.description: Description : The secret sauce for an absolute jacked body. Don’t do steroids it’s a joke.

item.title: DEADFACE 2024 - Winning Factors
item.author: theSaucese
item.description: Description : As another test of your programming prowess, Turbo Tactical wants to see if you can write a script to solve mathematic equations being served by a remote server within 3 seconds.

item.title: CSAW 2024 - Obfuscation
item.author: theSaucese
item.description: The goal of this challenge is to reverse this highly obfuscated binary and get the correct passphrase Explanation The program asks for a passphrase, because of that and the name of the program I assumed there would some passphrase obfuscated, so I decompiled it : Couldn’t understand anything so I checked if maybe it was packed ? Nope, okay we’ll let’s use BinaryNinja then : 93A3 is our function, so let’s set a breakpoint at the start of it and see what happens to our input :

item.title: BlackHatMEA 2024 - RD What Now?
item.author: theSaucese
item.description: I have some files missing but I think I can figure it out anyways. Explanation Typical “Z3 solver/whole lotta conditions” challenge, but written in R. We start with a file that contains a bunch of zlib files. We can use binwalk to extract these files. The files contain a bunch of non sense and couple strings like 0.0.9000, quick google search and we find that it has something to do with R :
